Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChessBoard

  • public class ChessBoard
extends java.lang.Object

    Creates a chessboard in a window on the desktop. The ChessBoard has a ChessBoardDisplay object that determines how the individual squares of the chessboard should be drawn.

    The chessboard uses a ChessGame object to determine how the game should be played. The way the chessboard works is as follows. The player selects a piece by clicking on the board, and and the chessboard calls the legalPieceToPlay method of the ChessGame object. If the player is allowed to select the piece, the board highlights it, and the player can select another square on the board. The chessboard then calls the makeMove method of the ChessGame object. The ChessGame is responsible for determining if the move is valid, and if it is to update the game and the chessboard with the results of making that move.

    Author:
    Harold Connamacher

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessBoard

        public ChessBoard(int numRows,
                  int numColumns,
                  ChessBoardDisplay boardDisplay,
                  ChessGame gameRules)
        Builds a board of the desired size, the display parameters, and the rules for the chess game.
        Parameters:
        numRows - the number of rows for the chessboard
        numColumns - the number of columns for the chessboard
        boardDisplay - an object that determines how the squares on the chessboard should be drawn
        gameRules - an object that determines when player selection is valid and to update the game with the result of a move

        public void addPiece(ChessPiece piece,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        Adds a piece to the board at the desired location. Any piece currently at that location is lost.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to add
        row - the row for the piece
        col - the column for the piece

      • hasPiece

        public boolean hasPiece(int row,
                        int col)
        Returns true if there is a piece at a specific location of the board.
        Parameters:
        row - the row to examine
        col - the column to examine
        Returns:
        true if there is a piece a this row and column and false if the square is empty

      • getPiece

        public ChessPiece getPiece(int row,
                           int col)
        Returns the chess piece at a specific location on the board.
        Parameters:
        row - the row for the piece
        col - the column for the piece
        Returns:
        the piece at the row and column or null if there is no piece there.

      • squareThreatened

        public boolean squareThreatened(int row,
                                int column,
                                ChessPiece piece)
        Returns true if a particular square is threatened by an opposing piece.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the square
        column - the column of the square
        piece - a piece of the game
        Returns:
        true if the square can be attacked by a piece of an opposing side as the parameter piece
